title: How to Dress a Short Waist

steps.title: High-rise pants don’t unlock your full potential.
steps.content: High-rise pants don’t unlock your full potential. They take up a lot of your outfit, and can leave your ensemble feeling a bit disproportional. [2] X Expert Source Sarah McDonald Certified Stylist & Image Consultant Expert Interview. 26 August 2021. Instead, grab a pair of mid- or low-rise pants instead—these make your legs look shorter and your waist look longer, which creates a really balanced outfit. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Empire-cut clothing helps re-define and lengthen your waist.
steps.content: Empire-cut clothing helps re-define and lengthen your waist. Unlike other dresses and skirts that sit on your hips or waist, empire cuts place the central seam directly beneath your bust. This really adds a lot of length to your figure. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Diagonal hems help your waist look a bit longer.
steps.content: Diagonal hems help your waist look a bit longer. The longer, lowest section of the shirt helps add some length to your torso, while the shorter end gives your outfit a bit of structure. Search through your closet or shop for diagonally hemmed tops to try out this cool, dynamic look! [5] X Research source

steps.title: Pick tops and bottoms in matching colors.
steps.content: Pick tops and bottoms in matching colors. [6] X Expert Source Sarah McDonald Certified Stylist & Image Consultant Expert Interview. 26 August 2021. Rifle through your closet and look for any pants, skirts, or blouses that are the same color. Pair up these items to create a really dynamic, cohesive outfit. The single color makes your waist look a lot longer. For instance, you might wear a navy blouse with a navy pair of slacks.

steps.title: Drop-waist dresses and tops make your waist look a lot longer.
steps.content: Drop-waist dresses and tops make your waist look a lot longer. As the name suggests, drop-waist dress seams fall around the hips instead of the bust or waist. This really lengthens your torso, which is great if you have a short waist. [7] X Research source

steps.title: A dramatic neckline helps lengthen your torso.
steps.content: A dramatic neckline helps lengthen your torso. This type of neckline helps make your waist look longer than it actually is. [8] X Research source Medium-length and long, dramatic V-necks are really great with a short waist. Stay away from boat-neck tops—these can make your waist look a lot shorter. [9] X Research source

steps.title: A well-supported bra helps maximize your torso.
steps.content: A well-supported bra helps maximize your torso. Unfortunately, a loose, less supportive bra leaves your bust a bit droopy, which doesn’t make the most of this body type. Instead, shop for a bra that really lifts and supports your bust—this helps you really maximize your torso. [10] X Research source It may help to double-check and re-measure your bra size before picking up any new bras.

steps.title: Grab a belt that’s 1⁄2 in (1.3 cm) or thinner.
steps.content: Grab a belt that’s 1 ⁄ 2 in (1.3 cm) or thinner. Unfortunately, belts can be a slippery slope if you have a short waist—chunky belts take up a lot of space, and really emphasize your short waistline. Instead, dig through your wardrobe for a really thin belt, which adds an extra dimension to your outfit without being over-the-top. [11] X Research source Low-lying belts work well if you have a short waist. You tie this belt very loosely around your waist, and let it naturally dip into a flattering V-shape. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Long accessories add some length to your outfit.
steps.content: Long accessories add some length to your outfit. Grab a long scarf or necklace, which helps change up the focus of your outfit. Pick accessories that help redirect the eye to different sections of your outfit, and draw attention away from the waist area. [13] X Research source For example, pendant necklaces are a great accessory option. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Leave your tops draping or half-tucked.
steps.content: Leave your tops draping or half-tucked. Tucking in your top can make your outfit look a bit unbalanced, which isn’t super great. Instead, let your top dangle over your waist or tuck part of it into your waistband. [15] X Research source For instance, you can tuck your top in front of your belly button, and let the rest dangle.

steps.title: Cropped jackets tend to emphasize your waist.
steps.content: Cropped jackets tend to emphasize your waist. When dressing a short waist, length is the name of the game. Unfortunately, cropped jackets sit close to your waist, and make your outfit a tad unbalanced. [16] X Research source
